Title: Lightfast Testing: 50+ Coloured Pencil Brands
Description: Discover the best and worst coloured pencils and markers for lightfastness, ensuring your artwork stays vibrant and doesn't fade too quickly.

Title: How Many Agents Does it Take to Beat PyTorch?(surprisingly not that much)
Description: Or: What happens when you give AI-agents a GPU and tell them to make it go brrr.

Title: Intra: design notes on an LLM-driven text adventure
Description: Last year I participated in a text adventure hackathon to build a text-based game using AI. I’d already been thinking about it but it was a great opportunity to put together those thoughts into something real. Since then I made many improvements, and while I’ve shelved the project for other endeavors I still want to write up what I’ve learned along the way.

Title: Bad Prompting Is the New Bad Engineering
Description: Built the same crossword app twice. Bad prompt took 6+ hours, good prompt took 40 minutes. Prompt engineering is actually a real skill.

Title: Building a message board for Claude, learning MCP along the way
Description:
I read an interesting post recently about creating a hackable AI assistant. There were a lot of things that appealed to me about it:

 * Simple. Not using abstractions like LangChain which have always felt a bit heavy to me
 * Custom context. Collect the data you need in regular code and

Title: Using Jujutsu (jj) to teach a course
Counting at Scale

Title: Lessons From Creating My First Text Adventure
Description:
When I write about the greatness of text adventures, I pretend they are easy to
make. They are, compared to many other types of games, but it’s still a bit of a
lie. They’re hard to make.

Title: Process Vs Prejudice
Description: I recently read an interesting article about Accountability Sinks. In it, the author argues that part of the reason for having business processes is that they diffuse accountability.  Every one of us has tried to have an argument with an employee of a big company, and it always goes like this:  the human being you are speaking to is only allowed to follow a set of processes and rules that pass on …

Title: Switch project, part 3 - what Microchip doesn't (officially) tell you about the VSC8512
Description:
This is part 3 of my ongoing series about LATENTRED, my project to create an open source 1U managed Ethernet switch
from scratch.

Title: How much code does that proc macro generate?
Description: Rust’s proc macros are powerful but tricky, and have some compile-time costs. This post is about a new tool to help quantify and reduce some of those costs.
